intro: Hybanthus enneaspermus var. latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf hybanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, violet-colored flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
